nl: Let $G$ be any group. Prove that the map from $G$ to itself defined by $g \mapsto g^{-1}$ is a homomorphism if and only if $G$ is abelian.
lean:
∀ {G : Type*} [Group G] (f : G → G)
  (hf : f = λ g => g⁻¹) :
  (∀ x y : G, f x * f y = f (x*y)) ↔ ∀ x y, G, x*y = y*x
candidate: ∀ {G : Type*} [Group G] (f : G → G) (h : ∀ x y, f (x * y) = f y * f x), f = Inv.inv
imports:
import Mathlib

open Fintype Subgroup Set Polynomial Ideal
open scoped BigOperators
